comments:
After reproducing the bug 
http://dev.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=13726

if you then try to get the project (to get all its files), you get the 
following dumped to the .log.

As a secondary issue, the reporting was a bit weak.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<log>
<log-entry date="Tue Apr 23 16:52:49 EDT 2002">
  <status
     plugin-id="org.eclipse.team.ui"
     severity="ERROR"
     message="Internal error occured."
     code="1">
    <exception
       message="Not Found"
       trace="
java.lang.RuntimeException: Not Found
	at org.eclipse.team.examples.core.webdav.DavState.getRemoteType
(DavState.java:163)
	at org.eclipse.team.examples.core.Symmetria.get(Symmetria.java:44)
	at org.eclipse.team.examples.core.SimpleProvider$1.visit
(SimpleProvider.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.team.examples.core.SimpleProvider.execute
(SimpleProvider.java:277)
	at org.eclipse.team.examples.core.SimpleProvider.get
(SimpleProvider.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.team.ui.actions.GetAction$1.execute(GetAction.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run
(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run
(Workspace.java:1347)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run
(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:78)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:98)
">
    </exception>
  </status>
</log-entry>
Note, reporting has since been overhauled.

Now fixed.  getRemoteType() is cached so we don't need to go to the server, 
hence no possibility of dav exception.
